title: Fabián Peña
text:
Fabián Peña González (born June 19, 1973 in <a href="Nuevo%20Laredo">Nuevo Laredo</a>, <a href="Tamaulipas">Tamaulipas</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>) is a retired <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> midfielder.
A product of the <a href="UANL%20Tigres">UANL Tigres</a> youth system, Peña spent a total of six years at the club before a move to Mexico City-based <a href="Necaxa">Necaxa</a> at the turn of the 21st century. After a brief return to Monterrey (this time with UANL Tigres' chief rivals - <a href="CF%20Monterrey">CF Monterrey</a>) in 2002, Peña returned to Necaxa, which had since found a new home in <a href="Aguascalientes">Aguascalientes</a>. In 2006, the 33-year-old made a high-profile move to Necaxa's sister club, <a href="Club%20Am%C3%A9rica">Club América</a>. Peña was able to join the ten-time league champion side prior to the Apertura 2006 season due to the departures of midfielders <a href="P%C3%A1vel%20Pardo">Pável Pardo</a> and <a href="Francisco%20Torres%20%28Mexican%20footballer%29">Francisco Torres</a> to <a href="Germany">Germany's</a> <a href="VfB%20Stuttgart">VfB Stuttgart</a> and <a href="Santos%20Laguna">Santos Laguna</a>, respectively.
